dismissable_rag_modal.description: You can now chat with your own documents using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). Here's how it works:

attach_files.title: Attach Files
attach_files.description: Upload up to 5 files at a time, with a maximum combined size of 30MB. Supported formats include PDF, DOCX, TXT, and CSV.

be_specific.title: Be Specific
be_specific.description: When asking questions, mention as many details as possible. This helps the system retrieve the most relevant information from your documents.

get_responses.title: Get Responses and Experiment
get_responses.description: The LLM will look at your query and the retrieved excerpts from your documents, and attempt to generate a response. Experiment with different queries to find what works best.

step_0.title: Beta: Tool Use üõ†Ô∏è (Function Calling)
step_0.text_0: Some models (e.g. Llama 3.1/3.2, Mistral, Qwen and more) were trained to use tools.
step_0.text_1: What this means in practice is: you provide an array of 'tools' (function signatures) to the LLM in a very particular format, and the LLM can decide whether to 'call' them based on the user's prompt.
step_0.text_2: You can imagine use cases such as querying an API, running code, or really anything that can be expressed as a function call.

step_1.title: Get started with Tool Use
step_1.toolUseCanWorkWithAnyModel:
Models that were trained for tool use will perform better than others, but you can try to use tools with any model whatsoever. Read the <customlink>documentation</customlink> to learn more.
Models that were trained for tool use will be marked with a new badge:
step_1.hasCompatibleModel: üéâ Looks like you already have models with tool support!
step_1.downloadRecommendedModel: Download a model that was trained for tool use:
